Imran Ahmed

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/1956523155005746
  • Última atualização do currículo em 13/08/2012

Eu sou bolsista de pós-doutorado junto ao Departamento de Matemática do Instituto de Ciências Matemáticas e de Computação da Universidade de São Paulo, em São Carlos, com o apoio de bolsa FAPESP, processo 2010/01895-3. O meu programa de Pós-Doutorado será de três anos, de 1/11/2010 a 31/10/2013. Eu estou trabalhando no projeto "Classificação Topológica de Singularidades". Possui doutorado em Geometria Algébrica - Abdus Salam School of Mathematical Sciences, GC University, Lahore, Pakistan (2008). Minha tese de doutorado é sobre Polar Cremona Transformations, Monodromy and Milnor Algebras. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2010 - 2012
Topological Classification of Singularities
Descrição: Singularity theory draws on ideas and techniques from algebraic and analytic geometry, algebraic and differential topology, and functional analysis. It is applied to problems in differential geometry, dynamical systems and the physical and life sciences. Current areas of research of the singularity group at São Carlos include the study of the geometry of finitely determined singularities in terms of their multiple point schemes, and the relationship between the invariants of these schemes and the topology of the maps and their generic deformations, as well as the study of the transition from geometrical questions to algebraic ones, based on Newton diagrams associated to the singularities. Here we intend to study invariants and the topology of singularities with special attention to non isolated singularities of sets and mappings. In this project we propose to study the following subjects: (1) polar Cremona transformations, Milnor algebras and Brieskorn modules; (2) classification of map germs; (3) topology and classification of singularities..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Imran Ahmed - Coordenador.
